forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 13 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 14 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn ushers in the new day over downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere hangs comfortably poised between the remnants of night and the promise of a sunny morning. With pleasant temperatures starting around 64 degrees, the day will gradually dip a couple of degrees, encouraged by a soft west-southwest breeze that dances through the streets. 

Currently, the city is kissed by a gentle layer of clouds; they roam in from the ocean, hinting at the marine layer that is characteristic of this coastal realm. Although fog has not entirely taken hold, expect a semblance of mist to linger near the bridges and waterfront, lending the skyline an ethereal veil. It’s a day that encourages exploration yet invites a thoughtful approach to clothing choices. A light jacket or sweater, preferably layered to combat the fluctuations of the afternoon breeze, will provide comfort amidst the shifting temperatures. 

As the day unfolds, it presents itself as an ideal backdrop for a stroll through the streets. Consider meandering through the city’s neighborhoods, perhaps pausing at a local café for a warm brew, listening to the soft hum of conversation mingling with the gentle rustle of leaves. The weather whispers of a day well spent, where one can immerse themselves in the simple joys of city life, absorbing the unique vibrancy that only San Francisco can offer.
